title: Drawing, Street in a town
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. Direction as in -7460. At left are two mansions and two stairs. The background with structures of different kinds, including a pyramid and a triumphal column upon a higher level; broad stairs are leading to it and a bridge crosses the lower street. On the reverse, sketches, in pencil, in vertical direction; at left, a clockcase, with two standing figures, flanking the dial, supported below by a kind of chalice; at right, a candlestick, with a pilllar as foot.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Street in a town. graphite. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7461
